channel.title: Course Contents on App Development
channel.description: Recent content in Course Contents on App Development

item.title: 1. Installation Guide
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: 1. Downloading Android Studio Go to developer.android.com/studio and download the latest stable release of the Android Studio IDE (green button). It comes with a JDK version to compile the necessary Java/Kotlin files and automatically downloads the correct Gradle version depending on your project file. Bear in mind that the installation will download the required Google Android Development Kit (SDK), chipping away yet another gigabyte form your download limit. Required IDE disk space: 1.

item.title: 1. Life Cycle - Activities
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: What’s an activity? An activity is a single, focused thing that a user can do.

item.title: 1. The Kotlin programming lang.
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: Why in Kotlin, Yet Another Language? Good question! The answer is multi-faceted: 1. Because Google Says So Google says you should Develop Android apps with Kotlin. It’s their recommended way of doing so. They state: Write better Android apps faster with Kotlin. Kotlin is a modern statically typed programming language used by over 60% of professional Android developers that helps boost productivity, developer satisfaction, and code safety. Among a slew of listed advantages, they have also created an Android Basics in Kotlin course, where the basics of the Kotlin language is the first hurdle to take.

item.title: 2. Common Errors FAQ
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: 1. minSdkVersion mismatch Error: “Expected minSdkVersion >= 21 but found 1” Cause: mismatch in build.gradle of android SDK and configured SDK in your emulator. Solution: just keep these the same. The error disappeared here after selecting for example 30/30. 2. Emulator process was killed? Error: Emulator: process was killed Cause: a hundred different things. Consult the Android Studio error log for more details—these aren’t displayed in the IDE.

item.title: 2. Kotlin Examples/Exercises
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: All examples can be found in the GitHub repository of this very course, at https://github.com/KULeuven-Diepenbeek/appdev-course/tree/main/examples We’ll be using IntelliJ to create simple Kotlin projects, so leave Android Studio closed for the moment. While creating a new project, choose A Gradle style project, Enable the Kotlin DSL Build Script, and finally Check Kotlin/JVM (uncheck Java) New Project settings for Kotlin Wait for the initial Gradle download/build to finish.

item.title: 3. Layouts - Views
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: Responsive design TODO geen px maar sd RecyclerView

item.title: 3. Links and Tutorials
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: Tutorials Official Android Developer Guide CodePath Android Cliffnotes Tutorialspoint.com Android Tutorial Vogella.com Android Development Tutorials Advanced Android UI Concepts Android Widgets on the home screen Drag-and-drop systems Notifications Various Awesome Android Kotlin Apps — a curated list on GitHub

item.title: 4. Project Information
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: Minimum requirements Every App should at minimum contain the following: Three activities: 1 master, 1 detail, 1 config screen One data request + parsing (HTTP GET Request) Use a RecyclerView Use at least one Intent Have a Menu with at least one option Use responsive design (do not hardcode px but use sp or dp) Use Fragments to vary the interface between landscape/portrait mode Use a data signal (GPS, Camera, accelerometer, …) 9 Contain at least one extra feature you can freely choose.

item.title: 5. Complex layouting - Fragments
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld, Kris Aerts)
item.description: What’s a fragment? Extend from Fragment from package androidx.fragment.app. Why use it? Reusability src: componentdriven.org
